response:
The clinical picture of subacute optic neuritis and multifocal myelopathy/hemispheric signs in a young adult is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating disease. Multiple Sclerosis is the leading differential. NMO and MOGAD must be excluded given the severity of visual loss.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis (Clinically Isolated Syndrome)", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus", "Behcet's Disease"]
